suncertify.db

Class SubcontractorCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.db.SubcontractorCache

  • public final class SubcontractorCache
extends java.lang.Object
    SubcontractorCache is used to store all contractor objects read from the database file in memory. When the application starts all records are read from disk into this cache stored as Subcontractor objects. The Data class is responsible for creating the cache on start up (and populating as a result of this) and flushing it's contents back to disk when the application terminates either normally or abnormally. From a design point of view the purpose of this class is to provide better performance as there is less disk I/O involved. It also guarantees data integrity as we can synchronize directly on the singleton cache object when modifying records. Also as we are not writing to disk in real time we avoid any bad writes say for example if the I/O stream terminates abnormally. The cache does not store any information about where the records are persisted in the database i.e. byte locations, it is purely used to hold subcontractor data.
    Author:
    Kieran O'Brien

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSubcontractor(int recordNo, SubcontractorRecord subcontractor)
      Adds a subcontractor record to the cache or if the cache already has this record number replace the existing fields with the new fields of the subcontractor object
      int[] findSubcontractors(java.lang.String[] criteria)
      Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.
      static SubcontractorCache getInstance()
      Returns the singleton cache instance creating it once if not already created
      SubcontractorRecord getSubcontractor(int recordNo)
      Returns a subcontractor record from the cache based on the record number key or null if the key does not exist
      void removeSubcontractor(int recordNo)
      Removes a Subcontractor object with the specified record number from the cache.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SubcontractorCache getInstance()
        Returns the singleton cache instance creating it once if not already created
        Returns:
        The Cache object

      • addSubcontractor

        public void addSubcontractor(int recordNo,
                    SubcontractorRecord subcontractor)
        Adds a subcontractor record to the cache or if the cache already has this record number replace the existing fields with the new fields of the subcontractor object
        Parameters:
        recordNo - The unique record number for this subcontractor record
        subcontractor - Subcontractor object

      • getSubcontractor

        public SubcontractorRecord getSubcontractor(int recordNo)
        Returns a subcontractor record from the cache based on the record number key or null if the key does not exist
        Parameters:
        recordNo - The unique record number key for this subcontractor record
        Returns:
        Subcontractor object

      • removeSubcontractor

        public void removeSubcontractor(int recordNo)
                         throws RecordNotFoundException
        Removes a Subcontractor object with the specified record number from the cache. Not only is this method used when deleting a record but also if an update is made to the subcontractor's name or location fields as this will result in a new record number for that subcontractor object
        Parameters:
        recordNo - The record number of the Subcontractor
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException

      • findSubcontractors

        public int[] findSubcontractors(java.lang.String[] criteria)
        Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n of the subcontractor record is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)
        Parameters:
        criteria - String array of search criteria. NOTE: This must not exceed a length of 6
        Returns:
        The integer array of all matching record numbers
